comment: Sweet finish. Very smooth. Love this stuff for the price.
According to Whisky Advocate, this scotch is matured from 6 to 8 years.

Neat:
Nose - dried fruit, sherry 
Palate - plum/prune, dried fruit, no burn
Finish - very short

Water:
Nose - about the same, slightly muted 
Palate - bit more peppery 
Finish - very short, slight burn
Orange marmalade, sherry, with a little lemon pledge and oak on the nose, oily, creamy with slightly spicy orange on the palate, the finish is medium length and slightly spicy

solid Sherry finished scotch. Nose: sweet, candied nuts, sweet dried fruit mostly dates for me. Taste: sweet on the front with Sherry dark fruit, some vanilla and grass. ends with just a bit of ginger spice and goes away fast. easy to drink. I love Balvenie DW, but for 1/2 the price this would be a easy alternaive.
Good weeknight dram. The sherry speaks to me. Really good scotch for the money.
A little harsh in the throat after taste.  Drinking head to head with Balvenie Doublewood.  No comparison.
Rich, dried fruit, and cedar without peat.
good, smooth, like the Sherry finish

Nose: grape candy, vanilla, toasted almonds 
Palate: honey, baking spices, leather

neat: star anise, chocolate, blueberry 

with water: leather milk chocolate
Unmemorible but drinkable, mellow sweet and short finish.

Nose: citrus, American oak
Taste: no sherry sweetness, oak, young, little hot
Finish: same as taste, short

I prefer Islay normally so find this a little boring. I actually get a lot of orange? Is that usual in the fruity sherried whiskies? I’m trying to get past it but that’s most of what I’m getting. This is smooth and easy drinking but I’m normally drinking something like a Cask Strength Laphroaig (or even a normal one) so at 40% surely it’s going to be easier than that.

Nose: Sweet. Fruit.
Palate: Sweet, full, a little salty
Finish: Short

Decent for the price, but not much more.

Nose: Smells like medicine
Paste: Finish is off. I was expecting a Sherry but it does not come through
Good flavor Sherry evident with notes of vanilla
Sweet start, strong Sherry on the nose, slight lingering burn
Sweet Carmel notes on the nose with a little oak.  Finish is dry with the sherry coming though at the end.

Got some of the vanilla from the oak that I assume was used before the sherry casks on the nose along with slight sherry and medicinal notes. 

Taste was about the same as the nose. Cigar flavor lingers after some time. Taste doesn’t last very long. 

Ok scotch but wouldn’t purchase a full bottle.
The whole grangestone line is a great introductory lineup for highland scotch. This might be the best of the alternative cask finishes.
The sherry taste overpowers a bit, but very good with a couple drops of water.
Full flavor, easy on the nose, sherry come in the end. With a couple drops of water it really opens up and becomes more full bodied with the sherry shining through
It wasn’t bad. The sherry cask gives it a bit of an overpowering taste. Kinda has a smoky taste but with a tiny bit of water it subdued that sherry/smoky taste and made it better.

N- sherry, cinnamon, raisins, wood
P- sherry, figs, citrus
F- dark fruits, peppery oak
Not bad but also not complex at all
I’m not mad at it. Just not a fan hopefully it’s the neck pour that make me feel that way.

This whisky is hard to find.... on the internet. 

Actually they sell this one in any total wine in USA and they offer tastings of it inside the store, but it doesn't seem to be anywhere online to even get a picture of it, or any other of their expressions. 

Talking about the whisky itself this one was a fruity fellow, who had a very bizarre finish.

On the nose: Lemon; very Fruity, Citric, grapefruit, lemon pie, apples,  currant, green mango. Stinky and fruity.

On the palate it has a very marked fresh fruit profile. Apples, pears, cereal with honey and a slight vanilla. 

Aftertaste is strange. Short finish, very fruity; There is something odd no bad, but not typical Like iron. 

Overall this is a whisky that HAS NO SHERRY INFLUENCE IN IT despite been a sherry cask finish. Boring and a little normal, you could use it instead of drinking juice, i guess. 72/100
